column4: hello everybody. I just updated to 10.04 and, upon booting, I'm getting message: "An error occurred while mounting 'blkid. Press S to skip mounting or M for manual recovery" and booting stops. I tried M once but, not knowing what to do, haven't tried again.  Please notice that the message includes the single quote before blkid; thats not a typo. I was told earlier to remove usbmount and hal...
...so ichecked an usbmount is not installed, removed hal and still had same problem so I just installed again. by What can I do?? TIA!
Sounds like your fstab had things added to it that shouldn't have been.  A LiveCD is your best bet for fixing it.
am a noob, can you please further ecxplain your answer? TIA
hmmm... are you telling me to reinstall 10.04?
No.  But you'll need to get to a state where you can edit your fstab (which is a file), and a LiveCD is probably the easiest way you're going to get there.
and how do i know what should and should not be there?

Well, from the LiveCD you come back and we'll walk you through it.  It either got something added to it, or it got over written.  If it's the former, we just remove the line with "blkid" on it.  If it's the latter, we'll have to create a new one, which isn't difficult and we can help you do so here.
could it be just the single quote before 'blkid?
blkid wouldn't be in that file normally.
ok, i'll do that, whats the location of fstab?
/etc/fstab (so it'll be in whatever partition is your harddrive, then in /etc/ then the "fstab" file)
ok, thanks, be back in a while
here's my fstab (http://dpaste.com/222625/) and this is the result of blkid (http://dpaste.com/222626/) Hope you can help. TIA!
The second line, put a # in front of it.
("Use 'blkid -o....)
thanks, will try that and let you know in 10
i havent been able to edit fstab ... can you please tell me how?
Are you on the LiveCD still?
no, i'm not, but i just did edit fstab. as nio pointed out, i was omitting sudo. let me reboot and i'll let you know what hapenned
That fixed two big issues, thanks un bunch!!!
Again, thank you very much. I've stil got at least half a dozen issues after upgrade to 10.04, but thats all for me today. I need a break. God bless you
